channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytip of old flooring dumped on pavement, 14th November
item.description:
A black plastic bin liner full of old wooden flooring has been dumped on the pavement outside 7 Bromley Grove. Please can this be removed. The bag has been there for a few days.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bromley Grove, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Low hanging tree branches over pathway, 14th November
item.description:
Very low Tree branches overhanging pavement (outside 1 Copperfield Road at junction with Voyagers Close) meaning that people have to walk in road past the obstruction thereby putting them in danger of being hit by vehicles. Been like it for months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Copperfield Road, London

item.title: Street lamps malfunctioning, 14th November
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rollesby Way, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hornbeam trees from park leaning towards summer house, 14th November
item.description:
I'm concerned about two hornbeam trees that are growing at an angle in the park towards our garden. They threaten to damage our summer house. They are moving a lot with the recent high winds and I have fears that the taller one could easily damage the summer house. Is it possible that you could remove these trees or heavily prune them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cow Path, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Danger to pedestrians, 14th November
item.description:
Thames water have created an extremely dangerous traffic/pedestrian situation in Honor Oak Road. Cars and vans are mounting the pavement to get round a poorly designed hole in the road. This needs urgent attention as pedestrians are at risk.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Canonbie Road, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple blocked drains on Crab Hill, 14th November
item.description:
The roadside drains nearest the junction of Crab Hill and Ravensbourne Avenue, and most of the other drains on the park side up to the top of Crab Hill, are nearly or totally blocked with debris. This causes a risk of water run-off from the full length of the adopted highway onto the unadopted section, with the risks as previously reported on numerous occasions. Please a) empty the drains as soon as possible b) design and implement a sustainble drainage solution c) DO NOT CLOSE THIS ISSUE UNTIL YOU HAVE DONE BOTH OF THE ABOVE. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road markings too close to corner â€“ safety concern, 14th November
item.description:
The double yellow lines on this corner were recently topped up, but a car was parked in the space at the time so the lines were not properly finished. As a result, the yellow lines now stop too far back from the corner. This creates a dangerous situation because cars are legally parking closer to the bend than they should, and anyone turning the corner has a very real risk of going straight into the back of a parked vehicle or the car park entrance there. The opposite side of the road has the markings correctly placed, so this looks like just an incomplete finish on one side. Could the lines please be extended properly to restore safe visibility around the corner?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wood Drive, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
